result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Alicia Marie Marz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
To run concurrent to Count 1 conditions.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation and Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court notes 1 day credit against ultimate sentence.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to DJOC

-Maintain employment or education.

c: Def & Atty. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

AMENDED July 29, 2015

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jeremy or Tammy C.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-No Contact with any Casino's or any place that participates in gambeling or online gambeling.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton, DF:  Alicia Marie Marz appeared. Case called at 9:39 a.m. ADA Hartung filed amended information alleging 2 counts of misdemeanor theft. Atty. Caton agrees to DJOC. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Amended Misdemeanor Ct 1 and Amended Misdemeanor Ct 2 in 15CF60. Ct 1: DEF to participate in Diversion Program. DE sworn, Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Amended Misdemeanor Ct 1 and Amended Misdemeanor Ct 2 in 15CF60. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
In Count 1 - DJOC 
-Costs
Court notes bond is Amended to a Misdemeanor Bond 

In Count 2 - 1 year probation to run concurrent to Count 1
Conditions: 
-30 days Imposed and STAYED, to be used at discretion of probation agent
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jeremy or Tammy C.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive or as recommended by Agent
-Mental health/Psychological assessment for gambling addiction and follow through with any recommendations
-Take a prescribed medications
-Maintain residence 
-Maintain employment or education
-Restitution amount: $3526 
-Costs
-Community Service 30 hrs
-Not present in Casinos, no participation in online, social media, bar/tavern gambling and including any and all forms of gambling
-Expungement upon anniversary of successful completion probation and DJOC (2 years)
-May transfer probation to MN
-1 day credit against any ultimate sentence
Plea hearing on July 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton DF:  Alicia Marie Marz appeared. Case called at 1:32. Atty. Caton updates the court. The State has made an offer. DE is now living with her Grandmother Ms. Post in Oakdale, MN. Atty. Caton requests a plea date. ADA Hartung agrees and responds regarding restitution. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
